entity.name: `popover` attribute (Popover API)
entity.description: HTML syntax and JS API facilitating popovers such as overlays, popups, menus etc.
entity.descriptionHtml: HTML syntax and JS API facilitating popovers such as overlays, popups, menus etc.
entity.descriptionClean: HTML syntax and JS API facilitating popovers such as overlays, popups, menus etc.

example.code: Popover content
example.codeHighlighted: <button popovertarget="foo">Toggle the popover</button> <div id="foo" popover>Popover content</div>

resources.title: The Popover API (previously Popup) · Issue #743 · w3ctag/design-reviews · GitHub

webFeature.description_html: The popover HTML attribute creates an overlay to display content on top of other page content. Popovers can be shown declaratively using HTML, or using the showPopover() method.
webFeature.name: Popover

resources.title: Tether elements to each other with CSS anchor positioning

webFeature.description_html: Anchor positioning places an element based on the position of another element. For example, you can place a tooltip next to the content it references.
webFeature.name: Anchor positioning

resources.title: Smooth and simple transitions with the View Transitions API

webFeature.description_html: The @view-transition CSS rule sets whether a document opts-in to transitions between documents in a multi-page application. Both the old and new document must opt-in for a transition to be triggered.
webFeature.name: Cross-document view transitions

entity.name: `<dialog>`
entity.description: Creates a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.
entity.descriptionHtml: Creates a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.
entity.descriptionClean: Creates a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.

example.code:
<dialog id="confirm">
	<form method="dialog">
		Are you sure?
		<button value="1">Yes</button>
		<button value="0">No</button>
	</form>
</dialog>
example.codeHighlighted: <dialog id="confirm"> <form method="dialog"> Are you sure? <button value="1">Yes</button> <button value="0">No</button> </form> </dialog>

webFeature.description_html: The <dialog> HTML element represents a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.
webFeature.name: <dialog>

entity.name: File System Access API
entity.description: Access files and directories on the user's local device and create writable files that can be updated.
entity.descriptionHtml: Access files and directories on the user's local device and create writable files that can be updated.
entity.descriptionClean: Access files and directories on the user's local device and create writable files that can be updated.

example.codeHighlighted: const handle = await window.showSaveFilePicker(); const writable = await handle.createWritable(); await writable.write("Hello, world!"); await writable.close();

webFeature.description_html: The showOpenFilePicker(), showDirectoryPicker(), and showSaveFilePicker() methods request access to files and directories on the user's device and returns a handle for reading and writing to them.
webFeature.name: File system access

example.codeHighlighted: html { scroll-timeline: --page-scroll block; } @keyframes grow-progress { from { transform: scaleX(0); } to { transform: scaleX(1); } } #progress { animation: grow-progress auto linear; animation-timeline: --page-scroll; }

resources.title: Unleash the Power of Scroll-Driven Animations
Animate elements on scroll with Scroll-driven animations

webFeature.description_html: The animation-timeline, scroll-timeline, and view-timeline CSS properties advance animations based on the user's scroll position.
webFeature.name: Scroll-driven animations

entity.name: Web Bluetooth
entity.description: Connect to and communicate with nearby Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) devices.
entity.descriptionHtml: Connect to and communicate with nearby Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) devices.
entity.descriptionClean: Connect to and communicate with nearby Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) devices.

example.code: const device = await navigator.bluetooth.requestDevice({ filters: [{ services: ["heart_rate"] }] });
example.codeHighlighted: const device = await navigator.bluetooth.requestDevice({ filters: [{ services: ["heart_rate"] }] });

resources.title: Communicating with Bluetooth devices over JavaScript

webFeature.description_html: The Web Bluetooth API enables selecting and communicating with nearby Bluetooth devices.
webFeature.name: Web Bluetooth

entity.name: Customizable Select
entity.description: Stylable, customizable dropdown control. Previously `<selectlist>` and `<selectmenu>`.
entity.descriptionHtml: Stylable, customizable dropdown control. Previously <selectlist> and <selectmenu>.
entity.descriptionClean: Stylable, customizable dropdown control. Previously <selectlist> and <selectmenu>.

resources.title: The selectmenu HTML Tag | CSS-Tricks - CSS-Tricks
Advanced Form Control Styling With Selectmenu And Anchoring API — Smashing Magazine

webFeature.description_html: The <select> element's appearance, including the button, selected option, picker dropdown, and options, can be customized using CSS.
webFeature.name: Customizable <select>

entity.name: File System Access API

entity.name: WebGPU
entity.description: A JavaScript API that provides low-level access to the GPU for high-performance graphics and parallel computation in the browser.
entity.descriptionHtml: A JavaScript API that provides low-level access to the GPU for high-performance graphics and parallel computation in the browser.
entity.descriptionClean: A JavaScript API that provides low-level access to the GPU for high-performance graphics and parallel computation in the browser.

example.code:
const adapter = await navigator.gpu.requestAdapter();
const device = await adapter?.requestDevice();
example.codeHighlighted: const adapter = await navigator.gpu.requestAdapter(); const device = await adapter?.requestDevice();

resources.title: WebGPU: Unlocking modern GPU access in the browser

entity.name: `SpeechRecognition`
entity.description: API that converts microphone input to text.
entity.descriptionHtml: API that converts microphone input to text.
entity.descriptionClean: API that converts microphone input to text.

example.codeHighlighted: const rec = new SpeechRecognition(); rec.lang = "en-US"; rec.addEventListener("result", e => console.log(e.results[0][0].transcript)); rec.start();

webFeature.description_html: The SpeechRecognition API converts audio into text using the device's speech recognition service.
webFeature.name: Speech recognition

entity.name: JPEG XL
entity.description: An image format optimized for web environments.
entity.descriptionHtml: An image format optimized for web environments.
entity.descriptionClean: An image format optimized for web environments.

entity.name: Temporal
entity.description: Provides standard objects and functions for working with dates and times.
entity.descriptionHtml: Provides standard objects and functions for working with dates and times.
entity.descriptionClean: Provides standard objects and functions for working with dates and times.

webFeature.description_html: The Temporal API allows you to work with dates, times, time zones, and durations. It is more powerful than the Date API.
webFeature.name: Temporal

entity.name: Web Share API
entity.description: Exposes a mechanism for sharing content to various user-selected targets.
entity.descriptionHtml: Exposes a mechanism for sharing content to various user-selected targets.
entity.descriptionClean: Exposes a mechanism for sharing content to various user-selected targets.

resources.title: Integrate with the OS sharing UI with the Web Share API

webFeature.description_html: The navigator.share() method invokes the device's native sharing mechanism and passes text, links, files, and other content to share targets.
webFeature.name: navigator.share()
